page.title: 09YOUTH ORGANISATIONS
page.content: There are many recreational outlets for the youth of Rossington, including Youth Clubs and the uniformed groups_ Scouts, Cubs, Guides and Brownies. The Girl Guides and the Brownies meet every Monday night at St. Luke's Church Hall. The Guides are the 51st Doncaster (South) Company part of the Torne Division. There are 20 girls in the Company, aged from 10 to 13 years, they form four Patrols _ Kingfisher, Robin, Thrush and Swallow. The Guides take part in many activities and have gained a variety of badges, which include Rambler, Friend to the Deaf, and Writers'. The Rossington Guides join with other Companies on special occasions. In July 1985 they will take part in the South Yorkshire Camp at Hesley Wood,Sheffield to celebrate 75 years of Guiding.
